demolition

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.GameObject
      • demolition.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BombGuy, EnemyRed, EnemyYellow

    public abstract class Player
extends GameObject
    The Player class is a abstract class for all the movable object in the game such as BombGuy, Red enemy and Yellow enemy. It is inherited from the GameObject

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int counter
      Use a to cycle the walk animation
      protected Direction[] direction
      The direction array store the values from Direction enum
      protected java.util.HashMap<Direction,processing.core.PImage[]> imageHashMap
      The image HashMap that store Direction as key and an array of PImage as value
      protected int index
      An index to help us in walk anaimation cycle
      protected int matrixX
      The grid position x of the Player, it indicates which row the Player is in
      protected int matrixY
      The grid position y of the Player, it indicates which column the Player is in
      protected Direction move
      The direction that Player face
      protected int speed
      Each grid space in term of pixel size, so Player can move one grid
      protected Wall[][] wallMap
      The 2-D array that store all the wall object and its child

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              int matrixX,
              int matrixY,
              Wall[][] wallMap)
        Constructor for Player
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the Player
        y - y-coordinate of the Player
        matrixX - the grid position x of the Player, it indicates which row the Player is in
        matrixY - the grid position y of the Player, it indicates which column the Player is in
        wallMap - the 2-D array that store all the wall object and its child
        See Also:
        GameObject, Wall

      • checkCollide

        public boolean checkCollide(Direction move)
        Check if the player is collided to the SolidWall or BroeknWall
        Parameters:
        move, - the Direction value from Direction enmu
        Returns:
        true, if the player did not collide the wall and the postion is updated, else return false and Player is collided to the wall
        See Also:
        SolidWall, BrokenWall

      • move

        public abstract void move()
        Move the Player depend on the Player type such as BombGuys and enemies

      • blastDie

        public boolean blastDie(int explosionX,
                        int explosionY)
        Check if the Player object is killed by the Bomb
        Parameters:
        explosionX - the row number of the bomb explosion impact position in the wallMap
        explosionY - the column number of the bomb explosion impact position in teh wallMap
        Returns:
        true, if the bomb explosion did impact the player, else return false

      • checkGrid

        public boolean checkGrid(int x,
                         int y)
        Check if the Player object is one the grid position that is provided
        Parameters:
        x - the row number in the wallMap grid
        y - the column number in the wallMap grid
        Returns:
        true, if the player is on the postion grid, else return false
